question.title: How to calculate the height occupied by a table in a PDF generated by JasperSoft Studio using iText 7 or any other libs (Java/Kotlin)?
question.body:
I have a PDF file generated by JasperSoft Studio, which contains a table that is smaller than the size of an A4 page. The PDF is available to me as a byte array encodded as Base64 String in my code, and I need to determine the height occupied by the table in the document. So far, Iâ€™ve tried using iText 7 in Java/Kotlin to extract the page size, but this gives me the full page size, not the content height. Here's the code I tried:

val document = PdfDocument(PdfReader(Base64.getDecoder().decode(pdfDocumentBase64).inputStream())) 
val documentPage: PdfPage = document.firstPage
val documentSize: Rectangle = documentPage.pageSize
val documentHeight = documentSize.height

However, this only gives me the full page size, not the height of the table on the page, which is what I need.

I also tried accessing the resources of the page with the following code:

val resources: PdfResources = documentPage.resources
val resourceNames = resources.resourceNames
println("Resource names: $resourceNames")

And I got the following output:

Resource names: [/CS, /F1, /F2, /F3]

To be honest i didn't get what to do with last information, so i asking for your assistance. Is there a way in Java/Kotlin using iText 7 or any other method to calculate the height of the content (specifically the table) on the page?

Here is example of my table. It has fixed width and dynamic height depending on inner content. Due to the fact that it has dynamic height i need to find some way to measure it
